meanings.definition: To say or plead in protest, objection, or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She was remonstrating with her parents about staying out late.
meanings.sent2: The students were remonstrating with the principal about the new school rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat was remonstrating with the closed door, demanding to be let in.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside seemed to be remonstrating with the windows, shaking them violently.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's loud cries were a form of remonstrating, expressing his displeasure at being put to bed.

meanings.definition: To argue or reason against something.
meanings.sent1: He was remonstrating against the idea of cutting down the old tree.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer was remonstrating against the unfair treatment of his client.
meanings.sent3: The dog was remonstrating against the vacuum cleaner, barking loudly at it.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashing against the shore seemed to be remonstrating against the incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The child was remonstrating with his friends, trying to convince them to play a different game.

meanings.definition: To express strong disapproval or disagreement.
meanings.sent1: She was remonstrating strongly against the new company policy.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were remonstrating loudly outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The cat was remonstrating with the empty food bowl, meowing in disapproval.
meanings.sent4: The wind was remonstrating with the trees, causing them to sway back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was remonstrating with the students, unhappy with their lack of effort in class.
